item.title: Eric add a quote by Roger Zelazny
item.description: "Time passed slowly, like and old man climbing a hill." -- Roger Zelazny

item.title: Eric add a quote by robert heinlein
item.description: "Writing is not necessarily something to be ashamed of, but do it in private and wash your hands afterwards." -- robert heinlein

item.title: Eric add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "You asked me once,' said O'Brien, 'what was in Room 101. I told you that you knew the answer already. Everyone knows it. The thing that is in Room 101 is the worst thing in the world." -- George Orwell

item.title: Eric add a quote by Clifford D. Simak
item.description: "A religion is a system of symbols which acts to establish powerful, pervasive, and long-lasting moods in men by formulating conceptions of a general order of existence and clothing those conceptions with such an aura of factuality that the moods and motivations seem uniquely realistic." -- Clifford D. Simak

item.title: Eric add a quote by Roger Zelazny
item.description: "The day of battle dawned pink as the fresh-bitten thigh of a maiden." -- Roger Zelazny

item.title: Eric add a quote by Roger Zelazny
item.description: "I'm a lost soul. We <i>do</i> wail." -- Roger Zelazny

item.title: Eric add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act." -- George Orwell

item.title: Eric add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Writing a book is a horrible, exhausting struggle, like a long bout with some painful illness. One would never undertake such a thing if one were not driven on by some demon whom one can neither resist nor understand." -- George Orwell

item.title: Eric add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Eric add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "I keep six honest serving men (they taught me all i knew); Theirs names are What and Why and When And How And Where and Who." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Eric add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "I am the Cat who walks by himself, and all places are alike to me." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Eric add a quote by charles stross
item.description: "Nothing stands for content-free corporate bullshit quite like PowerPoint. And that's just scratching the surface..." -- charles stross

item.title: Eric add a quote by Charles Stross
item.description: "Like the famous mad philosopher said, when you stare into the void, the void stares also; but if you cast into the void, you get a type conversion error. (Which just goes to show Nietzsche wasn't a C++ programmer.)" -- Charles Stross

item.title: Eric add a quote by H. P. Lovecraft
item.description: "Bunch together a group of people deliberately chosen for strong religious feelings, and you have a practical guarantee of dark morbidities expressed in crime, perversion, and insanity." -- H. P. Lovecraft

item.title: Eric add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "The puppet thinks: Itâ€™s not so much what they make me do as their hands inside me." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Eric add a quote by Lucius Annaeus Seneca
item.description: "For what prevents us from saying that the happy life is to have a mind that is free, lofty, fearless and steadfast - a mind that is placed beyond the reach of fear, beyond the reach of desire, that counts virtue the only good, baseness the only evil, and all else but a worthless mass of things, which come and go without increasing or diminishing the highest good, and neither subtract any part from the happy life nor add any part to it? A man thus grounded must, whether he wills or not, necessarily be attended by constant cheerfulness and a joy that is deep and issues from deep within, since he finds delight in his own resources, and desires no joys greater than his inner joys." -- Lucius Annaeus Seneca
